snippet: Pension funds that have increased expensive investments in private equity, real estate and hedge funds have been outperformed by stocks and bonds in the last five years.
abstract: Public workers' pension funds, which have increased expensive investments in private equity, real estate and hedge funds, have been outperformed by stocks and bonds in the last five years, for a fraction of the fees; analysis of sampling between some states' funds presents an unflattering portrait of the riskier bets; the funds with a third to more than half of their money in private equity, hedge funds and real estate had returns that were more than a percentage point lower than returns of the funds that largely avoided those assets.
lead_paragraph: Pension funds that have increased expensive investments in private equity, real estate and hedge funds have been outperformed by stocks and bonds in the last five years.

headline.seo: Pension Funds Making Alternative Bets Struggle to Keep Up
headline.main: Pensions Find Riskier Funds Fail to Pay Off
headline.print_headline: Pensions Find Riskier Funds Fail to Pay Off
